Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @blackjok3r  I think this is what you were referring to Figured it out. The "myipaddress" file in .Barterdex directory was empty for some reason. Put my ip in there manually, lanuched it and started giving all kinds of errors. I deleted the file and let bdex create it on the next launch and the ip was filled in and my orders are showing up now."

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: From here using MacOs 10.12.6 Sierra the newest version is launching without an issue for now

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: To find the IP file open the app and click `Debug > Show App Data`. The folder that then pops up will contain a folder called `marketmaker`, open that folder. The IP file should be inside called `myipaddr`. That should work on all OSs

Content: if you deleted app data then you deleted the mm IP file too

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: BarterDEX is the name of the network

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: there are two GUI implementations

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: one also called BarterDEX

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: and one called HyperDEX

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: well, there may be more, but those are the two most popular I'm aware of

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so you have the BarterDEX GUI and the HyperDEX GUI which are both GUI frontends for the BarterDEX network
